title: VR-Based Real-World Learning: Mobile Microlearning for Social Worker Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic social welfare theories and fundamental understanding of educational methodologies
context.additional_context: Focuses on implementing real-world learning using VR and low-cost virtual materials in smartphone-based limited-technology environments for pre-service and in-service teachers

learning_goals: Learners analyze real-world cases encountered in social welfare settings via VR simulations and propose at least three intervention strategies
Learners design educational scenarios using low-cost virtual materials (360-degree videos, 3D modeling, etc.) and achieve over 80% suitability through peer evaluation
Learners apply the SATNAV framework in mobile environments to establish innovative, sustainable educational strategies and implement them in actual classes

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
